gurmukhi: ਕਿ ਕਰਮੰ ਪ੍ਰਨਾਸੀ || ਕਿ ਸਰਬਤ੍ਰ ਦਾਸੀ || ਕਿ ਅਲਿਪਤ ਅੰਗੀ || ਕਿ ਅਾਭਾ ਅਭੰਗੀ ||੨੫੪||
transliteration: Ki Karman Pranaasee|| Ki Sarbatra Daasee|| Ki Alipat Anee|| Ki Aabhaa Abhanee||254||
translation: He was the destroyer of Karmas, the servitor of all, everywhere, unattached and glorious.254.

gurmukhi: ਕਿ ਸਰਬਤ੍ਰ ਗੰਤਾ || ਕਿ ਪਾਪਾਨ ਹੰਤਾ || ਕਿ ਸਾਸੱਧ ਜੋਗੰ || ਕਿਤੰ ਤਿਅਾਗ ਰੋਗੰ ||੨੫੫||
transliteration: Ki Sarbatra Gadtaa|| Ki Paapaan Hantaa|| Ki Saasaddh Jouang|| Kitan Tiaag Rogadg||255||
translation: He was the goer to all the places, the remover of sins, beyond all ailments and the one who remained a pure Yogi.255.
End of the description of the Elventh Guru, the king Surath.
Now begins the description of the adoption of a Girl as the Twelfth Guru

gurmukhi: ਚਲਾ ਦੱਤ ਅਾਗੇ || ਲਖੇ ਪਾਪ ਭਾਗੇ || ਬਜੈ ਘੰਟ ਘੋਰੰ || ਬਣੰ ਜਾਣ ਮੋਰੰ ||੨੫੬||
transliteration: Chalaa Datt Aage|| Lakhe Paap Bhaage|| Bajai Ghant Ghoran|| Baan Jaan Moran||256||
translation: Then Dutt moved further; seeing him, the sins fled away; the thunderous sound of the songs continued like the song of the peacocks in the forest.256.

gurmukhi: ਨਭੰ ਨਾਦ ਬਾਜੈ || ਧਰਾ ਪਾਪ ਭਾਜੈ || ਕਰੈ ਦੇਬਯ ਅਰਚਾ || ਚਤੁਰ ਬੇਦ ਚਰਚਾ ||੨੫੭||
transliteration: Nabhan Naad Baajai|| Dharaa Paap Bhaajai|| Darai Debya Archaa|| Chatur Bed Charchaa||257||
translation: The horns were sounded in the sky and the sins of the earth ran away; he made offerings to the goddess and there was the discussion about the four Vedas.257.

gurmukhi: ਸ੍ਰੁਤੰ ਸਰਬ ਪਾਠੰ || ਸੁ ਸੰਨਯਾਸ ਰਾਠੰ || ਮਹਾਂ ਜੋਗ ਨਯਾਸੰ || ਸਦਾੲੀ ੳੁਦਾਸੰ ||੨੫੮||
transliteration: Sroutan Sarab Paathan|| Su Sannyaas Raathan|| Mahaan Jog Nyaasan|| Sadaaiudaasan||258||
translation: Recitation of all the Shrutis was performed for that Sannyas at the suitable place; the great practices of Yoga were held and there was atmosphere of detachment.258.

gurmukhi: ਖਟੰ ਸ਼ਾਸਤ੍ਰ ਚਰਚਾ || ਰਟੈਂ ਬੇਦ ਅਰਚਾ || ਮਹਾ ਮੋਨ ਮਾਨੀ || ਕਿ ਸੰਨਯਾਸ ਧਾਨੀ ||੨੫੯||
transliteration: Khatan Shaastra Charchaa|| Ratain|| Bed Archaa|| Mahaa Mon Maanee|| Ki Sannyaas Dhaanee||259||
translation: There was discussion of six Shastras and the recitation of the Vedas and the Sannyasis observed great silence.259.

gurmukhi: ਚਲਾ ਦੱਤ ਅਾਗੈ || ਲਖੇ ਪਾਪ ਭਾਗੈ || ਲਖੀ ੲੇਕ ਕੰਨਿਅਾ || ਤਿਹੂੰ ਲੋਗ ਧੰਨਿਅਾ ||੨੬੦||
transliteration: Chalaa Datt Aagad|| Lakhe Paap Bhaagad|| Lakhiek Kanniaa|| Tihnoo Log Dhanniaa||260||
translation: Then Dutt move still further and seeing him, the sins fled away; there he was a girl, making the three worlds blessed ones.260.

gurmukhi: ਮਹਾ ਬ੍ਹਮਚਾਰੀ || ਸੁ ਧਰਮਾਧਿਕਾਰੀ || ਲਖੀ ਪਾਨ ਵਾ ਕੇ || ਗੁਡੀ ਬਾਲ ਤਾਂ ਕੇ ||੨੬੧||
transliteration: Mahaa Brahmchdaree|| Su Dharmaadhikdaree|| Lakhipaan Vaa Ke|| Gudibaal Taan Ke||261||
translation: This authority of Dharma and the great celibate saw a doll in her hand.261.

gurmukhi: ਖਿਲੈ ਖੇਲ ਤਾ ਸੋ || ੲਿਸੋ ਹੇਤ ਵਾ ਸੋ || ਪੀਅੈ ਪਾਨ ਅਾਵੈ || ੲਿਸੋ ਖੇਲ ਭਾਵੈ ||੨੬੨||
transliteration: Khilai Khel Taa So || Iso Het Vaa So|| Peeai Paan Aavai|| Iso Khel Bhaavai||262||
translation: She was playing with it and she loved it so much that she drank water and continued to play with it.262.

gurmukhi: ਗੲੇ ਮੋਨ ਮਾਨੀ || ਤਰੈ ਦਿਸ਼ਟ ਅਾਨੀ || ਨ ਬਾਲਾ ਨਿਹਾਰਯੋ || ਨ ਖੇਲੰ ਬਿਸਾਰਯੋ ||੨੬੩||
transliteration: Gad Mon Maanee|| Darai Dishat Aanee|| Na Baalaa Nihdaryo|| Na Khelan Bisdaryo||263||
translation: All those silence-observing Yogis went to that side and they saw her, but that girl did not see them and did not stop playing,263.
